issues.description: The constructor signature of PersonResource differs between the template and the solution. In the template, PersonResource is constructed with a single PersonService parameter, but the solution adds an extra String apiKey parameter. This mismatch will confuse students and break Spring’s constructor-based autowiring.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the extraneous String apiKey parameter from the PersonResource constructor in the solution so that both template and solution use the single-parameter constructor PersonResource(PersonService personService).

issues.description: The problem statement refers to REST endpoints using the `/api/persons/...` prefix (e.g., `PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents`), but both the template and solution code define their mappings at the root (`/persons/{personId}/parents`) without any `/api` prefix. This mismatch may lead students to implement or call the wrong path.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the `/api` prefix from all endpoint examples in the problem statement to match the code’s `/persons` paths, or add a base path of `/api` to the `@RequestMapping` on `PersonResource` so that the code and description share the same `/api/persons` prefix.
